name: Basmati Rice Pilaf

ingredients.ingredient: basmati rice, rinsed until water runs clear

instructions: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain well.
In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the diced onion and sauté until soft and translucent, about 3–4 minutes.
Stir in the drained rice and toast for 2–3 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add the chicken broth and bay leaf. Bring to a gentle boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover tightly, and simmer for 15 minutes without lifting the lid.
Turn off the heat and let sit, covered, for 5 minutes.
Remove the bay leaf, fluff the rice with a fork, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Sprinkle with chopped fresh parsley just before serving.

storage_tips.refrigeration: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days. Reheat gently in the microwave or on the stovetop with a splash of water.
storage_tips.freezing: Freeze cooled pilaf in a freezer-safe container for up to 1 month. Thaw and reheat gently.
storage_tips.make_ahead: Can be made earlier in the day and gently reheated before serving. Add fresh parsley just before serving.
